intro: Zanthoxylum subspicatum, commonly known as the prickly ash or American prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and spiny branches. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to red, fleshy berries in the fall. Its bark and leaves contain bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine and herbal remedies. Zanthoxylum subspicatum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and streambanks.
